item.title: 里夫斯的税收转向重燃预算忧虑，英镑走软
item.description: 据报道，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将在本月的预算中放弃提高所得税的计划，这再次引发了人们对英国财政状况的担忧。【原文：The pound underperformed its major peers on Friday as reports that Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is dropping plans to raise income tax at this month’s budget reignited concerns over the nation’s finances.】

item.title: 印度最大贷款机构支持又一波银行合并浪潮
item.description: 印度国家银行（State Bank of India）支持国家支持的贷款机构再次掀起合并浪潮，因为政策制定者正在探索如何在全球增长最快的主要经济体中扩大规模并为增长提供资金。【原文：State Bank of India is supportive of another wave of mergers among state-backed lenders as policymakers explore ways to build scale and finance growth in the world’s fastest-growing major economy.】

item.title: 反犯罪、反移民的主张推动了智利基督教民族主义者卡斯特的发展
item.description:
九个孩子的父亲、欧尔班和博尔索纳罗的盟友何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特（José Antonio Kast）希望驱逐无证移民，让智利重新变得安全。【原文：

José Antonio Kast, a father of nine and ally of Orbán and Bolsonaro, wants to expel undocumented migrants to make Chile safe again.

】

item.title: 制裁破坏了俄罗斯石油运输商通往中国的北极航线
item.description: 由于美国的制裁，俄罗斯通过北冰洋的石油运输正遭遇越来越多的延误，这是一个新的例子，说明美国的制裁措施正在给莫斯科的能源贸易增加摩擦。【原文：Russia’s oil shipments through the Arctic Ocean are encountering increasing delays because of US sanctions, a fresh example of how the measures are adding friction to Moscow’s energy trade.】

item.title: 印度与加拿大在美国加征关税之际深化能源与矿产关系
item.description: 根据一份联合声明，印度和加拿大将共同努力确保关键矿产和清洁能源供应链的安全，这标志着在美国政策导致的贸易紧张局势下双边关系的重启。【原文：India and Canada will work together to secure supply chains in critical minerals and clean energy, according to a joint statement, signaling a reset in bilateral ties amid trade tensions driven by U.S. policies.】

item.title: 贝莱德将与 ACS 组建价值 20 亿欧元的数据中心合资企业
item.description: 贝莱德公司已同意支付高达 20 亿欧元（23.3 亿美元），与西班牙工程公司 ACS SA 成立一家数据中心合资企业。【原文：BlackRock Inc. has agreed to pay up to €2 billion ($2.33 billion) to form a data center venture with Spanish engineering firm ACS SA.】

item.title: 南非顶级航空公司与工会在 20 国集团峰会前达成协议
item.description: 南非最大的航空公司 FlySafair 表示已与机组人员达成协议，在南非主办 20 国集团峰会前一周结束了赔偿问题上的僵局。【原文：South Africa’s largest airline, FlySafair, said it reached an agreement with cabin crew, ending a deadlock over compensation a week before the country hosts world leaders at the Group of 20 summit.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：里夫斯考虑放弃提高所得税计划，英镑下跌
利雅得银行获得 15 亿美元贷款，中东地区对亚洲的贷款创历史新高
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯最大的贷款机构之一利雅得银行（Riyad Bank SJSC）获得了一笔 15 亿美元的银团贷款，主要来自大中华地区的银行。【原文：One of Saudi Arabia’s largest lenders, Riyad Bank SJSC, has secured a $1.5 billion syndicated loan, primarily from banks in Greater China, as Middle Eastern borrowers tap Asian bank liquidity at record level.】

item.title: 南非抨击信用评级 "偏见"，等待评级升级
item.description: 南非欢迎评级公司提升其信用等级，但财政部长伊诺克-戈东瓦纳（Enoch Godongwana —）表示，评级公司对非洲大陆的偏见是真实存在的，他对此并不抱希望。【原文：South Africa would welcome an upgrade of its credit score, but Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana — who says ratings-company bias against the continent is real — isn’t holding his breath.】

item.title: 谷歌在 30 亿欧元的欧盟反垄断诉讼中提供广告技术调整方案
item.description: 在受到近 30 亿欧元（约合 34 亿美元）的反垄断处罚后，谷歌主动提出调整其广告技术产品，以解决欧盟的一项命令，但并没有达到监督机构所希望的部分分手。【原文：Google has offered to tweak its ad tech products to settle a European Union order after a near-€3 billion ($3.4 billion) antitrust penalty, stopping short of a partial breakup watchdogs favor.】

item.title: 卢比接近历史最低点，印度央行在离岸市场抛售美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度储备银行周五在离岸无本金交割远期市场上抛售美元，当时卢比徘徊在历史最低点附近。【原文：The Reserve Bank of India sold dollars in the offshore non-deliverable forwards market on Friday as the rupee hovered near a record low, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 诺和诺德新董事长在梅塞拉事件后被敦促控制风险
item.description: 将诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk A/S）首款减肥药推向市场的高管将重新担任这家丹麦制药商的董事长，但并非所有股东都对此感到高兴。【原文：The executive who brought Novo Nordisk A/S’s first weight-loss shot to market is coming back as chairman of the Danish drugmaker, and not all shareholders are happy about it.】

item.title: 德意志银行提高回报目标，缝纫机公司制定下一步计划
item.description: 在克里斯蒂安-索温（Christian Sewing）展望其在德意志银行股份公司任期的下一个阶段时，投资者正准备看到更多相同的东西：零售部门的节约和投资银行的定向支出。【原文：As Christian Sewing looks to map out the next stretch of his tenure at Deutsche Bank AG, investors are preparing for more of the same: savings at the retail unit and targeted spending at the investment bank.】

item.title: 中央百大的利润因一次性大幅增长而飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 泰国最大的购物中心开发商之一 Central Pattana Pcl 在一次性收益和消费活动复苏的推动下，公布了创纪录的季度利润。【原文：One of Thailand’s largest mall developers, Central Pattana Pcl, posted a record quarterly profit, powered by one-off gains and a revival in consumer activity.】

item.title: 谷物和大豆在美国重要供应报告发布前保持稳定
item.description: 谷物和大豆在一份重要的美国报告发布前保持稳定，该报告将简要介绍全球供应前景；自 9 月份以来，该关键数据一直因政府停摆而被推迟。【原文：Grains and soybeans steadied ahead of a crucial US report that will provide a snapshot on the outlook for global supply — key data that’s been delayed since September by the government shutdown.】

item.title: 喷气发动机短缺导致泰国航空公司运力增长放缓
item.description: 泰国国际航空公司（Thai Airways International Pcl）表示，飞机发动机短缺阻碍了公司的扩张，明年的座位数增长将放缓。【原文：Thai Airways International Pcl says a shortage of aircraft engines is hampering its expansion, with seat capacity growth set to slow next year.】

item.title: 亚洲的人工智能热潮面临现实考验，外国人加深了对亚洲的投资
item.description: 由于估值过高和风险偏好减弱削弱了信心，全球投资者正以至少七个月来最迅猛的速度从亚洲最大的人工智能市场撤资。【原文：Global investors are pulling money from Asia’s biggest AI markets at the sharpest pace in at least seven months as lofty valuations and waning risk appetite dent confidence.】

item.title: 最新人工智能模型未能打动谨慎的投资者，百度业绩下滑
item.description: 百度公司股价创下七个月来最大跌幅，原因是其最新版本的人工智能模型令投资者大失所望，从而削弱了该公司收复被同行甩下的失地的希望。【原文：Baidu Inc. shares fell by the most in seven months as the newest version of its artificial intelligence model underwhelmed investors, denting hopes for it to regain ground lost to peers.】

item.title: 马来西亚不畏美国关税，预计 2025 年经济增长接近 4.8
item.description: 马来西亚预测，在第三季度出口部门抵御了美国关税的影响后，今年的经济增长将可能接近 4.8%。【原文：Malaysia predicts growth this year will likely approach 4.8% after a resurgent exports sector defied the impact of US tariffs in the third quarter.】

item.title: 美国与韩国讨论联合建造核动力潜艇
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，美国和韩国正在私下谈判为两国海军联合建造核动力潜艇，这是两国同盟关系可能发生的重大转变，将超出两国总统两周前宣布的范围。【原文：The US and South Korea are in private negotiations to jointly build nuclear-powered submarines for both navies, a potential major shift in their alliance that would go beyond the announcement made by the countries’ presidents two weeks ago, people familiar with the matter say.】

item.title: 中国家庭加大股票购买力度，显示对反弹的信心
item.description: 中国家庭正重新涌入股市，这表明他们在 9 月份的净退出可能只是昙花一现。【原文：Chinese households are piling back into the stock market, suggesting their net withdrawal in September may have just been a blip.】

item.title: 人民币兑主要贸易伙伴汇率飙升，中国出口面临风险
item.description: 中国人民币对一些最重要贸易伙伴国的货币汇率攀升至多年高点，这对中国日益恶化的出口形势是一个警示。【原文：China’s yuan climbed to multi-year highs against some of its most important trading partners’ currencies, a cautionary note for its worsening export situation.】

item.title: 中国前财政部长警告房地产萧条将加剧通货紧缩
item.description: 中国前财政部长楼继伟警告说，中国房地产市场的低迷将持续下去，并加剧通货紧缩的压力，他呼吁采取更多刺激措施来缓解经济增长。【原文：China’s property market downturn will continue and worsen deflationary pressures, former Finance Minister Lou Jiwei warned, calling for more stimulus to cushion growth.】

item.title: 日本高市称企业过于重视股东利益
item.description: 日本首相高市真奈周五表示，日本企业过于关注股东，她希望看到更多的公司财富分配给员工。【原文：Japanese businesses are focusing too much on shareholders, Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said Friday, adding that she hopes to see more company wealth distributed to employees.】

item.title: 中国首次寒潮导致全国气温骤降
item.description: 未来几天，中国将迎来本季节的第一次寒潮，预计全国各地的寒冷程度将超过正常水平，这可能会影响电力需求。【原文：China will see its first cold wave of the season in the coming days, with chillier-than-normal conditions expected across the country, which may impact power demand.】

item.title: 中国经济数据为前景蒙上阴影，铜价收窄周涨幅
item.description: 中国 10 月份经济活动的降温幅度超过预期，对世界头号金属消费国的需求前景构成了压力，铜和铝的周涨幅随之缩小。【原文：Copper and aluminum trimmed their weekly gains after China’s economic activity cooled more than expected in October, weighing on the demand outlook for the world’s top metal-consuming country.】

item.title: 投资者称巴基斯坦债券涨势将随全球经济复苏而延续
item.description: 据投资者称，随着信用评级的上调和巴基斯坦政府重新进入全球债务市场的计划提振了市场情绪，巴基斯坦的美元债券可能会延续涨势。【原文：Pakistan’s dollar bonds will likely extend their rally as credit-rating upgrades and the government’s plans to re-enter global debt markets bolster sentiment, according to investors.】

item.title: 中国中芯国际预计 2026 年汽车和手机将面临内存短缺问题
item.description: 国际半导体制造公司（Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. ）警告说，内存短缺可能会在 2026 年制约汽车和消费电子产品的生产，在主要芯片制造商优先考虑与人工智能加速器关键厂商英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. warned that a shortage of memory may constrain car and consumer electronics production in 2026, flagging potential bottlenecks at a time major chipmakers are prioritizing business with AI accelerator linchpin Nvidia Corp.】

item.title: 马来西亚就 1.12 亿美元的 1MDB 诉讼与贝尔公司进行调解
item.description: 马来西亚表示已与瑞士宝盛集团有限公司（Julius Baer Group Ltd.）展开调解谈判，以解决失败的 1MDB 发展基金的一个单位对这家瑞士银行提起的 1.12 亿美元的诉讼。【原文：Malaysia said it’s entered mediation talks with Julius Baer Group Ltd. in a bid to settle a $112 million lawsuit filed against the Swiss bank by a unit of the failed 1MDB development fund.】
